item.title: 45 – Judge
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: #45 – Judge Do not judge a man By his words But by his actions. But what if his best actions Are the words he makes? What then?
item.content:encoded:
#45 – Judge

Do not judge a man
By his words
But by his actions.

But what if his best actions
Are the words he makes?
What then?

item.title: 44 – Artistic Pruning
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Artistic Pruning Just a lonely little white sign with a phone number and such an odd slogan alone in an unadorned yard. I imagined a garage full of swatches of color, digits and whole limbs made of marble or bronze, … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Artistic Pruning

Just a lonely little white sign
with a phone number
and such an odd slogan
alone in an unadorned yard.

I imagined a garage
full of swatches of color,
digits and whole limbs
made of marble or bronze,

entire fourth acts cut
characters running dead lines.
Banker boxes of word confetti,
enjambed last stanzas and lame lyrics.

Stacks of left feet peeled
from all sorts of choreography.
Jars of musical notes clamoring
but for the one full of rests.

If only such a place existed.
Though it’s probably cold
and a little dusty.
Just a little room

among old bicycle parts,
sundry garden implements,
once-used snow tires
and a rusty barbecue

for a desk and lamp,
a heavy-glass ashtray
and a single seat, a place
to sit and wonder.

item.title: 43 – purple rain / white guilt
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: purple rain / white guilt what right? is what rings as i walk away a couple bucks in a jar a black man his guitar and a drummer jamming out Prince covers to a lunch-time crowd that could care less … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
purple rain / white guilt

what right? is what rings
as i walk away
a couple bucks in a jar
a black man his guitar
and a drummer jamming
out Prince covers
to a lunch-time crowd
that could care less

i wish i’d shaken hands
learned their names
heard a little more
than the songs they love
but no–guilt toting fear
swoops in to ruin the moment
what right? walk on, man…

damn they’re good
and the drummer smiled
attacking his plastic buckets
not because of my money
but for the love
he was lost in
the groove
i’m the one left stewing
not him, man
he’s gone

item.title: 42 – poem of opportunity
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: poem of opportunity the folded dollar in my pocket the chewed up dog collar in the weeds the kid losing a bloody tooth in the grocery store the Hawthorne Bridge in a warm wind the glass of whiskey going down … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
poem of opportunity

the folded dollar in my pocket
the chewed up dog collar in the weeds
the kid losing a bloody tooth in the grocery store
the Hawthorne Bridge in a warm wind
the glass of whiskey going down warm
the bend of the river the bend of my back
the pavement grit in my eye
the man in the purple jacket crossing the street
the scrap of verse tugging like a fish on a line
the fresh feeling after the thaw
the way the geese the way the mallards
the flash of a woman I think I knew once
the lights in the house on
the feeling when no no one is home
the hot eye of the stove top
the movement of steam over soup
the mewling of the cat
the collective breath that is worry and relief
the tidings the night brings

item.title: 41- Jackal
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Jackal I ate at them with my eyes. Devoured their disease. I breathed their stale scent, their smoke and sepsis. I picked apart worn stories. I sat close, hand in jaundiced hand, slow pulse still kicking in the wrist. I … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Jackal

I ate at them with my eyes.
Devoured their disease.
I breathed their stale scent,
their smoke and sepsis.
I picked apart worn stories.
I sat close, hand in jaundiced hand,
slow pulse still kicking in the wrist.
I asked after kids and family
that never came. I searched
sunken eyes. I could almost
taste it. Almost. No bones to gnaw
but memory: Willy’s glossy black arm
the flat of his brittle bones nestled
in a faded red sweater. His neat fingernails.
The dying ficus. Withered balloons. Heavy
afternoons barely living in that house.
I left by the backdoor.

item.title: 40 – ice storm
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: ice storm the music fades each note a strain silence is the song at rest a bellied soundlessness empty gong of how we hear so muted our ears attune anew learn a different listen day is long and night is … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
ice storm

the music fades
each note a strain
silence is the song

at rest a bellied
soundlessness empty
gong of how we hear

so muted our ears
attune anew learn
a different listen

day is long
and night is long

of a sudden crack
sharp edges edging
where void ran on

crash and shatter
folded rills soft
break geometric

violence thaws
the song resumes
inside the world

item.title: 39 – Cowboy
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Cowboy Creamy broadcloth shirt, Mennonite-make, spattered in blood. Like his hands. He looks lost under his flat-brim hat. His partner (father?) stands. A shame. Nothing to be done. Calf was injured, boy. She fought. Soaked the tall timothy grass. He’s … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Cowboy

Creamy broadcloth shirt, Mennonite-make,
spattered in blood. Like his hands. He looks lost
under his flat-brim hat. His partner (father?)
stands. A shame. Nothing to be done. Calf was injured,
boy. She fought. Soaked the tall timothy grass.
He’s thinking Issac. He’s thinking God damn it.
They’ll drag it out behind the barn and burn it
on an altar of mesquite and cardboard.
They’ll toss the hooves to the dogs.
They’ll wash up and go back to work.
They’ll have to.

//after Peter Byrne’s series on 21-century cowboys; sixth photo down//

item.title: 38 – Crocus
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Crocus late night snow fall found mid-morning frozen in the side yard dusted over broken nose an odd crocus sharp-angled hips and fingers crook’d in farewell our bodies are mostly water frozen crystalline weavings sliced cross-wise snowflakes each unique silent … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Crocus

late night snow fall
found mid-morning
frozen in the side yard
dusted over

broken nose an odd crocus
sharp-angled hips
and fingers crook’d
in farewell

our bodies are mostly water
frozen crystalline weavings
sliced cross-wise snowflakes
each unique

silent spinning refracting
light glittering in slow descent
to earth under hill at rest
in the side yard

item.title: 37 – snow
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: snow smooth it all out, baby rub down the edges of street signs, trash cans, hedges step out on the porch with your Makers and water let the fat flakes hiss on the hotplate your lips and cheeks are streetlamp … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
snow

smooth it all out, baby
rub down the edges
of street signs, trash cans, hedges
step out on the porch
with your Makers and water
let the fat flakes hiss
on the hotplate
your lips and cheeks are
streetlamp fuzzes a golden bell
the whole world’s gone under
porch light leaves your shadow
and the smoke from your cigarette
the sharpest things going

item.title: 36 – Polluting the Data Pool
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Polluting the Data Pool What’s about to happen? I fill out a very specific version of me– known name(s), address, DOB, SSN– hit send and wait a few months for what, exactly? A file full of intrigue and odd cross-checked … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Polluting the Data Pool

What’s about to happen?
I fill out a very specific version of me–
known name(s), address, DOB, SSN–
hit send and wait a few months for
what, exactly? A file full of intrigue
and odd cross-checked connections
I’d never in a million years put together
as worthy of inquiry? Or just a one-pager
detailing my FOIA filing? Is that vain?
I say there’s no reason for the FBI
or CIA or anyone else (except
Target, Amazon, Apple and the like)
to keep track of me–but I don’t mean it,
really. I want to matter, flatter my ego
a little. I marched in a protest, once!
I’ve signed a petition or two in my time!
Maybe I look like some sort of interloper;
but just enough to be of interest,
not so much to cause arrest. It’s a fine line
to demand of my government. Take notice
but not too close. Who knows. Maybe
strange cars will linger outside my house,
men in trench coats will visit my friends
and the other end of my phone line
will now hold odd “empty” echoes and clicks.
Or maybe in a few months, when I’ve forgotten
the whole episode, I’ll receive a plain folder
under my door, empty but for this poem.
